since_last_update: Policy-tail-risk compression: President Trump signed a ~$1.2T funding package on Feb 3, ending the partial shutdown, but DHS funding is only extended for ~2 weeks (next cliff around Feb 13) so political-risk premium is reduced but not eliminated (Washington Post, Guardian).

Geo-risk reintroduced: U.S. forces shot down an Iranian Shahed-139 drone that approached the USS Abraham Lincoln; adds near-term event-risk bid (oil/defense/safe havens) even if follow-through remains uncertain (AP, Forbes).

Dominant equity narrative shifted back to AI-disruption/tech de-rating: Feb 3 saw a broad tech/software/data-analytics selloff tied to fears that new AI tools could compress pricing power and disrupt incumbents; this is now the key tape driver into today’s session (FT, AP).

Gold/silver volatility remains a live cross-asset risk: sharp rebound after the recent ‘crash’ keeps “margin/forced deleveraging” spillover risk elevated (especially if positioning is still crowded) (Business Insider, Guardian).

Earnings adding dispersion rather than a single macro impulse: notable idiosyncratic downside in Uber premarket on Feb 4 (profit outlook/margins/taxes) reinforces stock-specific vol within an already fragile growth/tech complex (Reuters via Yahoo Finance).
today_focus: Main driver check (today): AI-disruption fear + tech multiple compression remains the dominant equity factor; watch whether the rotation persists (value/defensives holding while growth/AI complex remains heavy) (FT, AP, Yahoo Finance).

Rates impulse catalyst: ISM Services PMI (Feb 4, 10:00 ET) is the cleanest macro trigger for a cross-asset move today; a stronger print risks higher real yields and renewed pressure on duration equities/Nasdaq, while a weaker print could stabilize NQ but may revive growth-scare framing.

Gold focus: treat the metal as a ‘stress barometer’ (liquidity + policy + geopolitics). Today’s risk is not direction but convexity—another large swing can transmit via VAR/margin to broader risk (Business Insider, Guardian).

Earnings tape: mega-cap/AI spending “health check” (Alphabet/other large tech) is the key micro-to-macro link for NQ; downside sensitivity is higher given concentration and recent de-rating (Barron’s, Yahoo Finance).

Geo-risk monitoring: watch for official follow-ups / retaliation headlines around U.S.-Iran maritime/air incidents; even without supply disruption, headline frequency can widen intraday risk premia and support gold (AP).

market_pricing.dominant_driver: AI-disruption led de-risking in software/analytics and broader tech-duration; second-order support from shutdown resolution, with geo-risk and precious-metals volatility acting as tail overlays (FT, AP, Washington Post).

equities.spx_nq_bias: Asymmetric downside for Nasdaq vs S&P: NQ remains more sensitive to further tech de-rating and earnings ‘AI spend’ optics; ES supported relatively by rotation/defensives and shutdown-tail-risk relief, but vulnerable if ISM re-accelerates yields (FT, Yahoo Finance).
equities.positioning_volatility: Elevated single-name and sector dispersion; risk that index-level calm masks continued stress in AI-adjacent software/analytics and crowding unwind dynamics (FT, Barron’s).

rates_usd.macro_sensitivity: High sensitivity to ISM Services as the next clean data point; market likely to express views via real yields and USD, with direct pass-through to gold and NQ duration (inference; catalyst from calendar).
rates_usd.underpriced_risk: Another ‘rates-up’ impulse (strong ISM/prices-paid) could re-tighten financial conditions quickly given fragile tech sentiment; this tail may be underweighted if participants focus mainly on earnings headlines (inference).

gold.what_market_is_pricing: A mix of dip-buying + safe-haven/geopolitical bid + unwind/relief from forced selling; volatility itself is now part of the story and can dominate short-horizon price action (Business Insider, AP).
gold.underpriced_risk: Liquidity/margin spiral risk persists if silver/gold swing forces cross-asset deleveraging; impact can show up first as wider intraday correlations and weaker high-beta equities (inference; supported by gold/silver volatility reports).

risk_register.risk: Tech-duration de-rating continues (AI disruption narrative broadens beyond ‘AI winners’ into software/analytics incumbents), dragging NQ and spilling into ES via concentration and risk-parity deleveraging
Rates re-acceleration on a strong ISM Services (and/or higher prices-paid), lifting real yields and compressing equity multiples; gold may not hedge cleanly if USD/real yields dominate
Gold/silver volatility triggers margin/VAR shocks → forced selling across equities/credit (correlations spike, intraday liquidity gaps)
U.S.–Iran incident follow-through (retaliation, shipping disruption headlines) lifts risk premia; oil up / equities down / gold up pattern, but highly headline-dependent
Shutdown ‘ended’ but DHS funding cliff around Feb 13 reintroduces political/policy uncertainty; risk premium can reappear quickly as the deadline approaches

event_warnings: Feb 4 10:00 ET: ISM Services PMI — key cross-asset catalyst; watch both headline and prices/paid/employment subcomponents for rates impulse.
Feb 4: Earnings-driven index concentration risk — large-cap tech results/guidance can dominate NQ direction even if macro is quiet (Barron’s, Yahoo Finance).
Feb 5: Initial jobless claims — can reinforce/undo any ISM-driven rates move; could matter more if the market is already leaning one-way on growth.
Feb 6: U. Michigan sentiment + inflation expectations — potential real-yield driver with direct implications for gold and duration equities.
By Feb 13: DHS funding deadline (implied by shutdown bill structure) — watch for renewed shutdown/political headlines as a volatility trigger (Washington Post).
